secText: Unlike other conversions you learned, converting between temperature scales may involve addition as well as multiplication.

A Celsius degree and a kelvin both measure the same amount of change − the difference in the systems is their zero points. This means converting between the two scales is a matter of addition or subtraction. To convert a Kelvin temperature to degrees Celsius, you subtract 273.15.
We also write the equations for converting from Fahrenheit to Celsius.  To convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit, first multiply, and then add.
